== Ubuntu Mobile Edition Applications ==

=== Browser ===

Ubuntu Mobile Edition includes a default web browser (Firefox). It should provide users with a consistent experience to the desktop version. The test cases listed here are merely a guideline for available features. Please explore all areas of the Browser not simply the areas detailed below.
* Gecko-based browser
* Bookmark launchers
* RSS feed reader
* Blogging plugin
* Bookmarks sync
* Reduced download interface 

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-browser| Browser Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Music Player ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition includes a media player (Rythmbox). This player handles multiple Audio formats. The media experience should be feature rich and highly functional. Playback of all available formats should be smooth and high quality.
* GStreamer framework
* Fluendo code pack
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-media| Music Player Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Video Player ===
Along with the Music Player, Ubuntu Mobile Edition also contains a video player (Totem).
* GStreamer framework
* Fluendo code pack
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-video| Video Player Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Photos ===
F-Spot <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-photos| Graphics Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Office Suite ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition Office Suite (Open Office, Adobe Acrobat Reader) supports the following document formats:
MS Word (.doc), OpenOffice (.odf), Excel (.xls), PowerPoint (.ppt), and
PDF file reading met in UNR by the addition of a PDF Viewer that is compatible with current Adobe Acrobat standards.

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-office| Office Suite Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== IM / Chat ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition IM/Chat Client (Pidgin) supports protocols for AIM, Windows Live Messenger, Yahoo Messenger, QQ (Most popular IM in Asia), Jabber, ICQ, and MySpace IM.<<BR>>
* Google Talk 
* Windows Live IM 
* AOL Instant Messenger
* ICQ
* Jabber
* MySpace IM
* QQ IM
* Yahoo!

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-im| IM/Chat Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Email and Pim Client ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition Email Client (Evolution) supports POP3 (POP3 before SMTP, APOP, TLS), IMAP4, SMTP (Plain auth, CRAM-MD5, DIGEST-MD5, TLS), GnuPG, RSS <<BR>>
* Google Mail 
* IMAP 
* POP 
* New mail notification
* Also including a full Person Information Manager system

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-evolution| Email and pim Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Camera ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition Camera application (Cheese) allows the Display/record video from camera, take snapshot with camera, save as JPEG, and Adjust camera settings

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-camera| Camera Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Product Recovery ===
A recover process is provided to end users.<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-recovery| Recovery Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== User Interface ===
Basic user interface cases to ensure the launcher and other non-application level interface features are functioning as designed. <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-interface| Interface Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Clock ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition Clock supports Digital/analog mode, time/date setting, Support regional setting, Alarm, Can sync with NTP, Dual timezone display, and Full screen mode (for use when docked)

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-clock| Clock Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Calculator ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition Calculator supports Basic calculating, memory function, and clipboard 

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-calculator| Calculator Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Remote desktop client ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition Remote desktop client supports VNC client, RDP client, Support for screen scaling and panning, and Stylus to Mouse click conversion

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-vnc| Remote desktop Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== E-book reader ===
The Ubuntu Mobile Edition E-book reader (FBReader) allow for the opening and navigation of e-book files.

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-ebook| E-book Reader Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Text Editor ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition Notepad allow for the creation and editing of simple text documents.

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-notepad| Text Editor Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Dictionary ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition includes a standalone dictionary application <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-dictionary| Dictionary Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Terminal ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition includes a bash terminal for command line access to the operating system<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-terminal| Terminal Test Cases]]</nowiki>

=== Phone ===
Ubuntu Mobile Edition includes VoIP based calling<<BR>>
<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/Cases/UbuntuMobile-apps-phone| VoIP Phone Test Cases]]</nowiki>
